title: Really ironic how Talon now loses lane to people he used to counter.
body: Used to counter Kat, but now if he all ins her, she just E, W, Ults ults the moment he blinks onto her.

replies.body: Not just with Kat, it's the same with Fiddle, Zed, Kassadin, and Annie. Without his silence, he can't stop much of anything. And he was one of the few viable counters to Kat.

So true. Just went up against Kat, and I was actually afraid of her if she decided to all in me. Luckily she did not, but I had a few close calls because I can't spam W, like she can Q. I even started Flask, and had trouble trading damage with her. Anytime I got her low, going all in meant I had to eat her ult, while her E is giving her 15% damage reduction.

I used to use talon vs annie mids.  Now i use annie to counter him. 

It was really dumb they took his silence away,

Now i am waiting for them to nerf my annie
It was really dumb he had the silence in the first place. It already puts him in a perfect spot to unload his combo, it shouldn't guarantee him a kill.

But it did not guarantee a kill. He was not 100-0ing people once he hit 6. He has to poke you down first, and in teamfights, someone should have an Oracle's Lens, or pink ward. He can only silence one person, one of the other 4 people on your team should have been waiting to CC him. 
On top of all that he received no real compensation, not even a channel cancel like Kassadin. Worse yet, the champions he was meant to counter now shit on him. Jump on Kat, she E's for 15% damage reduction and ults back, jump on Annie, easy Tibbers, jump on Zed, he ults you, Fiddle will fear or silence you, and Kassadin can Riftwalk out of the burst.

Pixel, HD. Talon Ain't What He Used To Be. Riot Boards. 20 October 2014, Web.

I like how you used exactly all the champs I listed, it would be nice to be cited. Preferably in MLA format.

Pixel, HD. *Talon Ain't What He Used To Be*. Riot Boards. 20 October 2014, Web.

There we go. But, yes, really. Talon's silence allowed him to be a counter-assassin. His job was to shut down champs with damage so high that the rest of his team can't confront them without dying.

{{champion:119}}  {{champion:103}}  {{champion:45}}  {{champion:1}}  {{champion:105}} 
{{champion:238}}  {{champion:38}}  {{champion:55}}  {{champion:92}}  {{champion:9}} 
{{champion:18}} {{champion:157}}  {{champion:115}}  Eh, maybe Ziggs

When these champs reach their power spike, you need high damage initiation to take them out. Without his silence, literally ALL of these champs can now counterattack him and probably kill him, if not just get away.
Viegar, Ahri, Annie, Ziggs, Fiddle, Tristana, and Draven can disrupt you and fight back. (Stun, Attract, Fear)
Fizz, Zed, and Kassadin can either leave quickly or become invulnerable from your assault and then fight back very easily
Riven, Yasuo, and Tristana will simply stun AND out damage you before your blink goes off cooldown again

So, yeah, he needs a silence. Many people I see who call for nerfs against talon have only played against him and not as him. I hate fighting Aatrox, but I'm not gonna say he's OP. Talon's silence wasn't even like, 3 seconds like Garen's or Fiddle's.

And if Riot is concerned with Assassin counterplay, nerf Ahri. She is an AP assassin, and her attract is a silence and a fear that brings you closer. No counterplay in that. Yasuo is an assassin, and he's allowed to be twice as OP as talon ever was.

I WOULD consider Talon OP if he was capable of easily downing tanks, but I don't see Talon offing a Volibear or Garen all that often. Talon's silence may looks like such a small thing. "It lasted like, what? A second?", but it was a major part of his kit, it made him the essential anti-hypercarry. 

If they will not give back the silence, give something of greater or equal value. I'm thinking somewhere in the range of a point blink like Kass's ult, or an Invis. Something that keeps him more viable than a .25 second slow. That's not even a slow: .25 second stumble.  I love their justification. "Just about enough time to get a hit in with your passive".
Ok, done.

Talon is an AD caster and i had champions that counter him if someone would had picked him. 

So to me what difference does it make compared to a burst mage that has real CC. Nothing. Just another mage that i used to counter pick with and now i dont pick him anymore, because there are better champions to counter annie and far more dangerous end game.
Welcome to the world of Cassiopeia.
I have still yet to play her after he rework. Played against one, and their damage was trash with 3 AP items.

Talon was already very 'meh' before silence removal. Now a CRAPPY SHIT 0.25 s slow to replace it is just a massive nerf with NO compensation. In contrast lucian/trist etc. get love taps that actually end up increasing their power half the time.

Riot is clearly hoping to go for a s5 'all ranged' team comps, in fact we pretty much saw a bunch of those at worlds already. Once they figure out a way to allow ranged ADC to outjungle melees their master plan will be complete

The 4.17 and 4.18 changes to Tristana were pretty much flat nerfs. The only way Tristana has more attack speed at any point than before is if she puts multiple points in Q very early and consistently uses Q, and doing so would only give her a slightly superior early game attack speed boost at the cost of everything else. Lucian is OP, but Tristana is balanced now. And no, Talon wasn't meh. Talon was very strong pre-nerf.

lol. So there are situations in which it comes out on top. That's more than I can say for talon's nerf where in every scenario his E is now basically worthless. Might as well build him as a max CDR tank now so he can slow people for his team to catch up, his damage was never good enough to compete with other champions that didn't have silence as it is. 

I don't know what random statistics you pull that place Talon as very strong pre nerf when Ryze, Rumble, Every ADC with a blink/dash,etc. completely outclass him in picks/bans win rate etc.

Even worse is that NA WASN'T EVEN tring to counter him with Janna and stuff like that until they went to worlds. 

I just hate how every time any assassin sees even miniscule play it's 'very strong' but that fucking lee sin or ranged ADCS that have been seeing play for ages are just supposed to be 'oh yeah ofc they are picked we need them'. Like ppl are going on about Fizz and Zed who were  TOTAL SHIT in the Worlds. Not even SSW could pull off Fizz against a team whose number they had completely. By the end there Zed wasn't even being considered by either side  because that crappy kit wasn't killing the ADC gods and Z ring exists as an item

I really don't see how people complain about Zed. That moment when you look at the enemy team and see Zhonya's on the AP Carry, or AP jungler, or AP top laner, and GA or Mercurial Scimitar on the AD Carry. If Zed can not end the game before they get the money for these items he is a weight on his team. All he can do is splitpush.
Last game I played I could literally ult no one but Gragas, who goes into every fight with % damage reduction, and has the CC to prevent me from dealing enough damage for that not to matter. Kat mid had Zhonya's, so did the Fid jungle, Vayne had GA, Thresh has all his peel to flay me off of anyone I am trying to kill. Like Zed is either THE MOST balanced champion in game, or severely underpowered.
Syndra can insta burst ppl, and has a slow aoe and stun aoe that is way better than talon since he had to jump to the target to do it, discuss.
Discuss what? How freelo she is? Impossible to miss the knockback assuming you somehow can't land the stun.

> Syndra can insta burst ppl, and has a slow aoe and stun aoe that is way better than talon since he had to jump to the target to do it, discuss.

Syndra does not have much mobility and is completely skillshot reliant. I think she needs a nerf on the width of her sphere-stun, but she has a chance to miss her cc. I do agree that Talon needs something to allow him to kill his targets without them destroying him, but honestly a silence against ability reliant champs is quite a difficult thing to overcome. If he has the silence, he is overpowered, but without it he is garbage. I think a snare + channel cancel would be a good fit for him, as it would allow him to hold his prey in place by disabling the use of movement spells (Flash{{summoner:4}}, Shunpo{{champion:55}}, Deathmark/Living Shadow{{champion:238}}, etc.) while also allowing him to counterplay specific matchups that he used to counter by canceling their channels (Death Lotus{{champion:55}}, Crowstorm{{champion:9}}, etc.). He would still be able to dodge skillshot abilities with his ultimate and allow enemies to still have counterplay on him with the use of their abilities, this way he doesn't automatically win the laning phase in specific matchups.

How is it not ironic? They took his silence in order to balance him, but it just made him underpowered, especially against the people he was supposed to counter. So in an attempt at balancing him, he still is not balanced.

My feeling is that katarina vs talon is a skill matchup. The main advantage talon has is that his burst is a lot quicker than katarina's (I manage to be as quick as 2 seconds to 100 to 0 them.) While katarina has a slower burst (qew combo takes like .5 seconds) so it takes 3 seconds for her to burst you. However the reason this is a skill matchup is because katarina has the opportunity to avoid talons w which is his main source of damage with her e. 
  They both have advantages and disadvantages against each other so this is a skill matchup.
Well...assuming EQUAL skill, the kat will win. SHe can ult the moment he walks into range and destroy her.

Are you Wing before you actually jump in with E? Because the moment you jump onto her, she E for damage reduction which drastically reduces Talon chances of killing her, and ult, meaning Talon has to flee or risk dying, so he can not get any extra autos of to ensure she dies. Now I was exaggerating a bit in the OP. She does not outright beat him, but the lane is more in her favor. Her Q spam is harder to avoid, and she is manaless. No way for Talon to not take damage anytime he jumps on her unless she foolishly used W to waveclear when she is not near tower.
